intro: Dasystephana calycosa, commonly known as the calyx-flowered bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant features showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette. Dasystephana calycosa is characterized by its distinctive calyx that persists even after the petals fall.
